class_notes: At the university we are encouraged to do our best intellectual work, however, we are not only brains floating from class to class or book to book. We are embodied individuals whose intellects also reflect our physical, emotional, and spiritual experiences. This class takes into account the entire body and person of the writer, with an emphasis on contemplative composition practices. Course readings will explore mindfulness, yoga, rest, and well-being. Communication assignments include journaling, sleep stories, and a researched presentation on healthy living.
course_description: A topical course in rhetoric, writing, or literacy in which students study theories and trends of literate practices with application in current culture. Course will build on principles learned in other course in the Writing Program.
